qas.question: In what year did the Netherlands gain independence from France?
What names were used in the Anglo-Dutch Treaty of 1814?

answers.text: "United Provinces of the Netherlands" and "United Netherlands"

qas.question: The Kingdom of the Netherlands was formed by which countries?
When did Belgium regain independence from France?

plausible_answers.text: "United Provinces of the Netherlands" and "United Netherlands"

qas.question: What names were Luxembourg known by in the Anglo-Dutch Treaty of 1814?

plausible_answers.text: the Kingdom of the United Netherlands

qas.question: What kingdom created a buffer state north of Belgium?

plausible_answers.text: the state became unequivocally known as the Kingdom of the Netherlands, as it remains today.

qas.question: What happened to the Kingdom of the United Netherlands after France became independent?

plausible_answers.text: In 1815 it was rejoined with the Austrian Netherlands, Luxembourg and Liège (the "Southern provinces") to become the Kingdom of the Netherlands

qas.question: What did the Southern provinces treaty accomplish for the Netherlands?

context: The Netherlands regained independence from France <b3_0>in <a0_0>1813<b3_0/><a0_0/>. In the Anglo-Dutch Treaty of 1814 the names <a1_0><b4_0>"United Provinces of the Netherlands" and "United Netherlands"<b4_0/><a1_0/> were used. <b7_0>In 1815 it was rejoined with the <a2_0>Austrian Netherlands, Luxembourg and Liège<a2_0/> (the "Southern provinces") to become the Kingdom of the Netherlands<b7_0/>, informally known as <b5_0>the Kingdom of the United Netherlands<b5_0/>, to create a strong buffer state north of France. After Belgium and Luxembourg became independent, <b6_0>the state became unequivocally known as the Kingdom of the Netherlands, as it remains today.
